alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:51AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WATERSPOUTS STILL BEING REPORTED NEAR THE MOUTH OF THE CHARLESTON HARBOR... At 949 AM EDT...the public and trained weather spotters continued to report waterspouts near the entrance to the Charleston Harbor. These waterspouts are very near the beaches at Folly Beach and Sullivans Island. HAZARD...Waterspout. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...There is a slight chance that the waterspout could move onshore as a very brief tornado. Light objects such as lawn furniture could become airborne if this occurs. Minor tree damage is possible. Some coastal locations that could be impacted include... Fort Sumter, James Island, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, and Fort Johnson. WATERSPOUT...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Waterspouts that move onshore become tornadoes. A tornado warning may be needed shortly if confidence in the waterspout moving onshore increases. Be prepared to take quick action if the waterspout approaches your location. Move to an interior room and away from windows.
